description.first: In our private tours, you have the option to choose your own itinerary with the attractions you want, with exclusive vehicle and guide.
description.second: Create the tour your way, selecting the sights that suit you best, at the time and pace you prefer.
description.third: Perfect for couples, families, or small groups seeking comfort, privacy, and a fully personalized experience in Rio de Janeiro.

description.first: The Carioca Tour is a complete journey through Rio de Janeiro's main attractions. We prepared the itinerary so you can discover the "Marvelous City" in the best possible way.
description.second: See Rio's main highlights in a single day: Christ the Redeemer, Sugarloaf Mountain, Selarón Steps, beaches, and the historic downtown.
description.third: This best-selling tour can also be done privately, giving you more time to enjoy each attraction.

description.first: On the helicopter ride, you experience the thrill of flying over Rio de Janeiro on a panoramic tour. From above, you can admire the golden beaches and be amazed by the city's breathtaking landscapes and Christ the Redeemer.
description.second: The experience offers an unparalleled view of the city's main attractions, ideal for those seeking excitement and stunning scenery.
description.third: Flying over Rio is a unique opportunity to see the Marvelous City from a new perspective — perfect for couples, families, and adventure lovers.

description.first: Visiting Christ the Redeemer is an unmissable experience for anyone visiting Rio de Janeiro. With accessible transport options and stunning views, it's a chance to experience one of Brazil's most famous icons.
description.second: Located atop Corcovado Hill, Christ the Redeemer offers one of the most spectacular views of the city, surrounded by the Tijuca Forest.
description.third: Visiting the Christ statue lets you feel the energy and beauty of Rio de Janeiro in one place — a must for anyone wanting to know the city's essence.

description.first: The tour includes a journey through Brazil's history, unique views of Tijuca Forest and the city, and the chance to visit Christ the Redeemer.
description.second: The historic train departs from Cosme Velho and climbs Corcovado Hill through lush vegetation, providing a charming experience.
description.third: Ideal for those seeking a calm tour, full of natural landscapes and a touch of nostalgia, combining nature and culture.

description.first: Sugarloaf Mountain is one of Rio de Janeiro's main landmarks, famous for its panoramic views and the cable car connecting Morro da Urca to the top of Sugarloaf.
description.second: The cable car ride offers unforgettable views of Guanabara Bay, Christ the Redeemer, and the city's beaches.
description.third: A must-see attraction for those who want to enjoy Rio's most beautiful sunsets and take stunning photos of the city.

description.first: The Maracanã Tour is a family-friendly experience and a special program for football fans. It's one of Rio's most sought-after attractions.
description.second: During the tour, you can explore locker rooms, warm-up areas, press rooms, and historical items from legendary players like Pelé, Zico, and Garrincha.
description.third: A dive into the history of Brazilian football in one of the world's most iconic stadiums — an exciting experience for fans and visitors alike.

description.first: Tall and conical, the modernist Rio de Janeiro Cathedral (Metropolitan Cathedral of São Sebastião) doesn't look like a typical church.
description.second: The unique design and colorful stained-glass windows impress visitors from all over the world, making the Cathedral a symbol of faith and modern architecture.
description.third: A must-visit for those who appreciate art, culture, and spirituality in the heart of Rio's historic center.

description.first: Decorated with over 2,000 colorful tiles in the colors of the Brazilian flag, the Selarón Steps are one of Rio de Janeiro's most vibrant and impressive landmarks.
description.second: Created by Chilean artist Jorge Selarón, the staircase is a true open-air art piece, connecting the Lapa and Santa Teresa neighborhoods.
description.third: A perfect spot for photos, culture, and history, capturing the creative and welcoming spirit of Rio de Janeiro.

description.first: A boat tour through Guanabara Bay is an unmissable experience for those wishing to explore Rio de Janeiro in a unique way.
description.second: During the tour, visitors can enjoy incredible views of Sugarloaf Mountain, Christ the Redeemer, and the islands composing the bay.
description.third: A relaxing and unforgettable tour, perfect for experiencing Rio from a new perspective, with comfort and stunning surrounding scenery.

AboutComponent.description: Hi, I'm Vicky, an independent tour guide in Rio de Janeiro. My mission is to make your time in the marvelous city truly unforgettable — from iconic landmarks to hidden gems that only locals know.
